alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 3:28PM EDT until June 26 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Camden County in southern New Jersey... Northwestern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 328 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Voorhees, or 10 miles east of Gloucester City, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Evesham, Mount Laurel, Willingboro, Voorhees, Medford, Lindenwold, Lumberton, Burlington, Mount Holly, Berlin, Beverly, Ramblewood, Echelon, Marlton, Jacksonville, Springdale, Atco, Greentree, Jobstown and Columbus. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 5. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 34 and 52. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
